A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Spoiler Warning!

 In my opinion\, this film was ok but thats all.

The script was trying to be funny too often and at times the dialogue was really bad. The main plot of the movie was the Resistance trying to escape from the First Order\, and that was it. A very long cat and mouse chase that should serve as a chapter in a story\, not the whole story. There was no details on how the First Order has moved to secure the galaxy since it destroyed the senate or the current state of the Republic other than suggestions through dialogue that it has been destroyed....that was easy.

The Finn subplot was uninteresting. Whenever his story line came up I just didn't care.

Rey and Lukes story was the saving grace of this movie. I did however feel that the story of the new trilogy took a u-turn in regards to Luke. In The Force Awakens the Resistance desperately needed Luke to fight the First Order and bring back the Jedi. When he finally showed up he lasted 5 minutes and the manner of his departure\, and his lack of interaction with the other characters ie Leia\, was very unfulfilling. Some may argue that he brought back the Jedi through Rey\, however this was a path she already seemed to be heading to with very little assistance from him.

As for Kylo. Why is he a bad guy again? Because he has a temper? please.

Its not a bad film\, there are plenty of great scenes with and without action but this just didnt feel like a Star Wars film and I left the cinema disappointed.
